author: 新华日报
title: 科技金融给企业送来及时雨
text:
碳纤维自行车、碳纤维羽毛球拍、碳纤维无人机、碳纤维航标、碳纤维小提琴、碳纤维家具……在国家级专精特新“小巨人”企业——连云港神鹰复合材料科技有限公司的碳纤维科技馆内，各类碳纤维产品让人眼花缭乱。
　　碳纤维具有轻质、高强、耐高温、耐腐蚀等诸多优势，应用领域很广泛。“我们深耕这个领域多年，专业从事碳纤维复合材料及其制品研发、生产及销售。”近日，企业相关负责人葛海涛说，“去年以来，企业加大研发投入，加快推动制造业智能化转型，不断引入先进设备，资金需求比较大。”
　　“我们在走访中得知企业的这个情况后，立即通过绿色审批通道，为该企业批复授信额度4000万元，并根据企业资金需求，已累计为其发放设备更新贷款1772万元，用于采购碳纤维复合材料相关设备，有效支持企业关键技术的研发生产。” 江苏银行 （ 600919 ）连云港分行公司业务部总经理赵轶楠说。
　　“科技之花”的绽放，需要“金融活水”的精准浇灌。作为服务地方经济发展的金融主力军，近年来，江苏银行连云港分行在市政府以及人民银行连云港市分行等部门的指导下，认真落实《关于提升科创金融供给能力服务高质量发展的实施意见》，从政策衔接、产品创设、配套资源、人才培养等方面细化目标任务，深入市场、深入企业开展“大走访大调研”活动，充分了解科创企业的需求，推出专项服务，探索出了一条独具特色的科创金融服务之路。
　　“我们企业是2016年成立的，第一笔贷款就是江苏银行连云港分行发放的。那会儿企业刚成立不久，很多项目暂时还没有产生收益，没有资金来源，很艰难。江苏银行连云港分行了解到我们的困难后，迅速为我们提供了100万元的人才贷支持，真是解了我们的燃眉之急。”连云港斯克斯机器人科技有限公司相关负责人说，“后来，由于业务规模扩大，银行主动为我们增额，发放了200万元的知识产权质押贷款，今年又发放了500万元的苏科贷。这几笔资金犹如及时雨，帮了我们的大忙。”
　　“我们银行推出的信贷产品比较多，基本可以覆盖连云港市科创企业的需求。每个季度我们都会跟市科技局对接一下，了解市里有没有新增的科技型企业。如果有的话，我们会根据市科技局提供的名单，一家一家对接，了解企业在科技创新方面有没有困难之处，有无资金需求。”江苏银行连云港分行普惠金融部（科技金融部）总经理钱卫东说。
　　“对于初创期企业，我们可以提供‘苏孵贷’‘凤还巢’等产品，用于支持科技企业孵化器在孵企业及回苏、留苏创业者。对于成长期企业，我们可以提供‘成长之星’‘高企贷’‘卡脖子专项贷’等产品。”钱卫东说，“针对新三板挂牌企业，我们可以提供以其股权作为质押的三板之星产品。对于成熟期企业，我们还可提供‘专精特新贷’，全力支持科创企业做专做强。”
　　此外，江苏银行连云港分行还设立了科技金融部和科技专营支行，着力为科创企业提升专业、便捷的一站式专享服务。成立分行科技金融服务推进专班，明确各部门职责，从分行层面为科创企业定制专属金融服务方案，为其提供全生命周期的科技金融服务。截至3月25日，该行科技贷款余额92.6亿元，较年初增加9.5亿元。
　　“我们将紧跟连云港市‘工业立市、产业强市’核心战略，倾力打造‘政府放心、监管省心、服务贴心、客户暖心、员工安心’的‘五心’银行，致力于真正成为港城人民自己的银行。同时，始终把服务地方发展放在首要位置，不断完善金融产品体系，提升金融服务质效，持续为地方经济高质量发展注入金融‘活水’。”江苏银行连云港分行党委书记、行长贾建明说。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing
Economy, Business and Finance->products and services

author: @Editor World News Era
title: Marco Silva: Fulham Manager's Reputation Enhanced By Historic Chelsea Win - WorldNewsEra
text:
[United Kingdom](../)
Marco Silva: Fulham manager’s reputation enhanced by historic Chelsea win
He has been the beneficiary of finally putting down roots at a club, allowing his coaching prowess – recognised throughout his career – the time to take effect.
He was highly-regarded at Hull City, even though his five-month spell from January to May 2017 ended in relegation.
Silva made an impressive start after being appointed Watford manager, but his head was turned when approached by Everton in November, following the sacking of Ronald Koeman. The advances were rejected amid acrimony but Watford’s form went into decline.
Before Everton’s approach, Watford only lost four out of 11 games but afterwards they suffered defeat in eight of the next 13. Silva was sacked in January.
Watford pointed the finger of blame firmly in Everton’s direction in their statement, at the time, saying: “The catalyst is that approach, something which the board believes has seen a significant deterioration in both focus and results to the point where the long-term future of Watford has been jeopardised.”
Everton eventually got their man in summer 2018, but cast him aside 18 months later before Silva’s managerial journey took him to Craven Cottage.
Silva now looks and sounds like a different man.
And this win at Chelsea was a coaching masterclass as he revealed how it was planned.
He said: “We knew Neto would push up on Chelsea’s right so we wanted to expose those spaces. This was our plan and we did it better in the second half with Antonee Robinson and pushing on.
“We wanted to expose that area in the way we prepared then get more bodies in the box in the second half, which we did and got our goals. If people think we deserved to win this match then I would agree with them.”
Fulham’s fans have come to idolise their manager, as proved by the wild outpouring of joy at the final whistle – and the feeling is mutual.
He said: “Football is about connections. Connections between fans, players and staff, means something really big. The most important thing is for the fans. It’s not about me at all.
“Some of the speeches before the game were about the fans. It’s been a long time [not winning at their neighbours]. We deserved it. We controlled more of the game. We didn’t give them chances.
“In the second half we started to make better decisions. All the good actions of the game give us confidence.”
Silva’s connection with Fulham and the club’s fans looks unbreakable – and he appears to be a manager who has finally found a home.

author: AOF
title: Près de 70 % des Français estiment avoir une faible éducation financière selon l'AFG et ELABE
text:
(AOF) - L’Association française de la gestion financière et le cabinet ELABE ont mené une enquête sur les connaissances financières des Français, leur épargne et leurs attentes en matière d’investissement. Parmi les enseignements à tirer de cette étude : une faible connaissance financière est un facteur d’inégalité et un frein à l’investissement à long terme. En effet, 70 % des sondés estiment avoir une faible éducation financière qui entraîne une limitation dans leur capacité à optimiser leurs placements et à adopter une stratégie d’investissement adaptée à leurs besoins.
À l'inverse, ils sont peu nombreux (13 % des Français) à adopter tous les bons réflexes pour limiter les risques et optimiser leurs placements.
En revanche, plus de la moitié (60 %) pense qu'il est utile ou prioritaire que leur épargne contribue au financement des entreprises françaises et européennes, une manière de soutenir l'économie et l'emploi. Toutefois, ils estiment que ce soutien à l'économie européenne devrait leur permettre de bénéficier d'une fiscalité plus avantageuse.
Enfin, s'ils sont nombreux à penser que leurs connaissances sont limitées, 65 % des Français, et même 80 % des 18-24 ans, sont favorables à la diffusion de l'éducation financière à l'école. Pour chercher de l'information, ils souhaitent profiter d'outils numériques pédagogiques, notamment pour les plus jeunes générations. Ainsi, 66 % des 18-24 ans plébiscitent les formats modernes et interactifs (vidéos, tutoriels, applications mobiles…). La confiance des Français va à leur banque ou aux professionnels agréés, à leur entourage familial ou amical, ou encore aux autorités publiques.

author: Team upday
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit - upday News
text: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit Share article Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit. Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday. Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected. They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am. Operations director Andy Smith said: "This has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I'm grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power." You may also like Read more from UK News National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck. Three men died after their 4×4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said. A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday. Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a "localised tornado" in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook. Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours' houses "are an absolute disaster" with missing roofs and "squished" cars. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults. Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day. In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday. Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel. Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal. The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground. Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: "Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit."
